Posts.Content: On Jun 23, 2012 3:58 PM lydian wrote: I, too, was post-menopause, ILC, bilat mast, and radiation.    My Onc prescribed Arimidex post treatment for a period of five years.  My ILC is estrogen positive.  I, too, was told the tamoxifen was given as post treatment preventative for recurrence to pre-menopause women and was told Arimidex would not work if pre-menopausal.  Once the ovaries stop producing estrogen, the adrenal gland continues to produce estrogen as our bodies continue to need this hormone beyond the reproductive years.  Arimidex shuts down the adrenal gland's production of estrogen.  The resulting side affects are a testiment to the body's natural need for estrogen.  I began taking arimidex November 2010.  In April 2012, I decided to stop taking it.  To me, the side affects had outweighed the risk of recurrence.   I am 52 years old and felt like 80+; fatigue, severe joint pain in hips, knees, and hands, weight gain, and overall a loss of quality of life.  Exercise gave no relief; if anything the side affects hindered exercise.  I could not imagine three more years of feeling like this.  Oddly, within a week of being off the arimidex, all side affects are gone!  What did happen, though, is since April, I am having menopause symptoms again! ; hot flashes are bearable but the ADD symptoms (inability to concentrate, make a  decision, focus, a feeling of unravelling) hopefully temporary until my body reacts to the estrogen changes (?)  Neither my Onc nor my PC have an explanation why this onset of menopause symptoms.  My menopause occurred 2005 - 2007 and my diagnosis was 2010!  Onward and upward....... I too have had to have 2 cancer surgeries. Ovarian and Brest cancer with 9 lymphs nodes removed. I had 9 months of Chemo and was out on Arimdex for 5 years, After they took my off of that, I now have more cancer. I have been looking for a lawyer for about 2 years now to take my case, but they keep telling me that the case should have been filed back when I was going through cancer surgeries. If anyone knows of a lawyer that can help me, Please let me know.
Posts.Title: Arimidex versus Tamoxifen??
